column2: TEXAS DRIVERS PERMIT TEST
column4: Texas
column6: TX

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.
column6: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.
column8: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.

column2: 2. When other drivers around you are acting in anger, you should:
column4: slow down or move over safely.
column6: avoid making eye contact.
column8: distance yourself from the situation.

column2: 3. Bicyclists must:
column4: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.
column6: remain near the left edge of the road.
column8: travel with more than two side-by-side in a single lane, if possible.
column10: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.

column2: 4. BAC is expressed in:
column4: ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column6: percentage of blood to alcohol.
column8: AAI (Acute Alcohol Intoxication) level.

column2: 5. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column6: stop doing what they are doing.
column8: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column10: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.

column2: 6. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.
column6: should not speed up or brake quickly.
column8: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.

column2: 7. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column4: at the next crosswalk.
column6: only if the traffic signal turns red.
column8: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.

column2: 8. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: must make a U-turn and then turn right.
column6: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.
column8: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.
column10: can turn left. You have the right of way.

column2: 9. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.
column10: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.

column2: 10. When the driver behind you wants to pass, you should:
column4: slow down to allow room for the other driver to complete the pass safely.
column6: change lanes.
column8: use your brake lights.

column2: 11. The yield sign means:
column4: You must come to a complete stop.
column6: Drive with caution in wet weather.
column8: The traffic light will soon be red.
column10: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.

column2: 12. A flashing yellow traffic signal means:
column4: No right turn.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: Stop and proceed when a green light appears.
column10: Slow down and be alert at the upcoming intersection.

column2: 13. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column6: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column8: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
column10: Stop only if you are sure that the vehicle is headed toward you in the opposite lane.

column2: 14. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column4: reduce the minimum following distance.
column6: keep less space in front of their vehicle.
column8: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.
column10: keep more space in front of their vehicle.

column2: 15. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column4: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.
column6: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column8: Rounabout rules apply.
column10: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.

column2: 16. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column4: you cannot change lanes.
column6: you cannot pass.
column8: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.

column2: 17. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: have a beer or two to keep you awake.
column6: avoid drinking coffee.
column8: turn on the radio to keep you awake.
column10: find a safe place to stop for a break.

column2: 18. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road ahead is narrow.
column6: the right lane ends.
column8: drivers in the left lane have the right-of-way
column10: there is a one lane bridge ahead.

column2: 19. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Apply the parking brake slowly.
column6: Rub your tires on the curb to slow your car.
column8: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.

column2: 20. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
column4: Regulation signs (regulatory signs)
column6: Destination signs (guide signs)
column8: Service signs

column2: 21. Select the most effective safety restraint(s) in a traffic crash.
column4: Lap and shoulder belt only
column6: Pumping brakes.
column8: Air bag only
column10: A combination of lap/shoulder belt and air bag.

column2: 22. Hydroplaning is a situation in which:
column4: the tires of the car ahead cause sheets of water to splash on your vehicle.
column6: your tires ride up on a thin surface of water, losing contact with the pavement, and resulting in sudden loss of control
column8: one of your tires goes flat, causing the others to skid.
column10: your tires throw water to the rear, causing problems for the vehicles behind.

column2: 23. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
column4: A cold remedy.
column6: Marijuana.
column8: Tranquilizers.

column2: 24. This sign means:
column4: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.
column6: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.
column8: No passing zone ahead.

column2: 25. This road sign is:
column4: a regulatory sign.
column6: a speed reduction sign.
column8: a warning sign.

column2: 26. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: The light will soon change from green to red.
column6: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column8: Drive with caution.

column2: 27. Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
column4: fix
column6: protect
column8: replace

column2: 28. Before backing up, you should:
column4: rely on your mirrors to see if it is clear to proceed.
column6: get off the car to see if it is clear to proceed.
column8: flash your headlights.
column10: turn your head and look through the rear window.

column2: 29. Drivers must yield for emergency vehicles:
column4: when they see a flashing red or blue light or hear a siren.
column6: Never.
column8: only when other vehicles yield.

column2: 30. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.
column6: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.
column8: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
